controls.title: Ensure autofs services are not in use
controls.description:
\

\f0\b0 \cf4 autofs
\f2 \cf2  allows automatic mounting of devices, typically including CD/DVDs and USB\
drives.\

\f1\b
controls.rationale:
\

\f2\b0 With automounting enabled anyone with physical access could attach a USB drive or\
disc and have its contents available in system even if they lacked permissions to mount\
it themselves.\

\f1\b
controls.impact:
\

\f2\b0 The use of portable hard drives is very common for workstation users. If your\
organization allows the use of portable storage or media on workstations and physical\
access controls to workstations is considered adequate there is little value add in\
turning off automounting.\
There may be
controls.audit_command:
\

\f2\b0 As a preference 
\f0 \cf4 autofs
\f2 \cf2  should not be installed unless other packages depend on it.\
Run the following command to verify 
\f0 \cf4 autofs
\f2 \cf2  is not installed:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # rpm -q autofs\
package autofs is not installed\

\f1\b\fs24 - OR -\
- IF -
\f2\b0  the package is required for dependencies:\
Run the following command to verify 
\f0 \cf4 autofs.service
\f2 \cf2  is not enabled:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl is-enabled autofs.service 2>/d
controls.remediation:
\

\f2\b0 Run the following commands to stop 
\f0 \cf4 autofs.service
\f2 \cf2  and remove 
\f0 \cf4 autofs
\f2 \cf2  package:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl stop autofs.service\
# dnf remove autofs\

\f1\b\fs24 - OR -\
- IF -
\f2\b0  the 
\f0 \cf4 autofs
\f2 \cf2  package is required as a dependency:\
Run the following commands to stop and mask 
\f0 \cf4 autofs.service
\f2 \cf2 :\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl stop autofs.service\
# systemctl mask autofs.service\

\f1\b\fs24
controls.references:
\

\f2\b0 1. NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 5: SI-3, MP-7
\fs20\fsmilli10080 Page 290\

\f0 Internal Only - General\

\f1\b\fs24

controls.title: Ensure avahi daemon services are not in use
controls.description:
\

\f2\b0 Avahi is a free zeroconf implementation, including a system for multicast DNS/DNS-SD\
service discovery. Avahi allows programs to publish and discover services and hosts\
running on a local network with no specific configuration. For example, a user can plug\
a computer into a network and Avahi automatically finds printers to print to, files to look\
at and people to talk to, as well as network services running on the machine.\

\f1\b
controls.rationale:
\

\f2\b0 Automatic discovery of network services is not normally required for system\
functionality. It is recommended to remove this package to reduce the potential attack\
surface.\

\f1\b
controls.impact:
\

\f2\b0 There may be packages that are dependent on the 
\f0 \cf4 avahi
\f2 \cf2  package. If the 
\f0 \cf4 avahi\

\f2 \cf2 package is removed, these dependent packages will be removed as well. Before\
removing the 
\f0 \cf4 avahi
\f2 \cf2  package, review any dependent packages to determine if t
controls.audit_command:
\

\f2\b0 Run the following command to verify the 
\f0 \cf4 avahi
\f2 \cf2  package is not installed:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # rpm -q avahi\
package avahi is not installed\

\f1\b\fs24 - OR -\
- IF -
\f2\b0  the 
\f0 \cf4 avahi
\f2 \cf2  package is required as a dependency:\
Run the following command to verify 
\f0 \cf4 avahi-daemon.socket
\f2 \cf2  and 
\f0 \cf4 avahi-\
daemon.service
\f2 \cf2  are not enabled:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl is-enabled avahi-daemon.socket avahi-daemon.ser
controls.remediation:
\

\f2\b0 Run the following commands to stop 
\f0 \cf4 avahi-daemon.socket
\f2 \cf2  and 
\f0 \cf4 avahi-\
daemon.service
\f2 \cf2 , and remove the 
\f0 \cf4 avahi
\f2 \cf2  package:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl stop avahi-daemon.socket avahi-daemon.service\
# dnf remove avahi\

\f1\b\fs24 - OR -\
- IF -
\f2\b0  the 
\f0 \cf4 avahi
\f2 \cf2  package is required as a dependency:\
Run the following commands to stop and mask the 
\f0 \cf4 avahi-daemon.socket
\f2 \cf2  and 
\f0 \cf4 avahi-\
daemon.service
\f2 \cf2 :\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl stop avahi-daemon.socket avahi-daemon.service\
# systemctl mask avahi-daemon.socket avahi-daemon.service\

\f1\b\fs24
controls.references:
\

\f2\b0 1. NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 5: SI-4
\fs20\fsmilli10080 Page 293\

\f0 Internal Only - General\

\f1\b\fs24

controls.title: Ensure cockpit web services are not in use
controls.description:
\

\f2\b0 cockpit Web services provide the ability to remotely administer the system via a web\
browser.\

\f1\b
controls.rationale:
\

\f2\b0 Unless there is a local site approved requirement for remote web based administration\
on the system, cockpit web server packages should be removed to reduce the potential\
attack surface.\

\f1\b
controls.impact:
\

\f2\b0 Removal of cockpit web service packages will remove the ability for remote web\
administration of that system.\

\f1\b - IF -
\f2\b0  the cockpit web services package is required for a dependency, any related\
service or socket should be stopped and masked.\

\f1\b Note:
\f2\b0  If the
controls.audit_command:
\

\f2\b0 Run the following command to verify 
\f0 \cf4 cockpit-ws
\f2 \cf2  is not installed:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # rpm -q cockpit-ws\
package cockpit-ws is not installed\

\f1\b\fs24 - OR -\
- IF -
\f2\b0  a package is installed 
\f1\b and
\f2\b0  is required for dependencies:\
Run the following command to verify 
\f0 \cf4 cockpit.socket
\f2 \cf2 , and 
\f0 \cf4 cockpit.service
\f2 \cf2  are not\
enabled:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl is-enabled cockpit.socket cockpit.service 2>/dev/
controls.remediation:
steps to mask a service are followed and that package is not\
installed on the system, the service and/or socket will still be masked. If the package is\
installed due to an approved requirement to host a web server, the associated service\
and/or socket would need to be unmasked before it could be enabled and/or started.
\fs20\fsmilli10080 Page 295\

\f0 Internal Only - General\

\f1\b\fs24 Audit:\

\f2\b0 Run the following command to verify 
\f0 \cf4 cockpit-ws
\f2 \cf2  is not installed:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # rpm -q cockpit-ws\
package cockpit-ws is not installed\

\f1\b\fs24 - OR -\
- IF -
\f2\b0  a package is installed 
\f1\b and
\f2\b0  is required for dependencies:\
Run the following command to verify 
\f0 \cf4 cockpit.socket
\f2 \cf2 , and 
\f0 \cf4 cockpit.service
\f2 \cf2  ar
controls.references:
\

\f2\b0 1. NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 5: CM-7
\fs20\fsmilli10080 Page 296\

\f0 Internal Only - General\

\f1\b\fs24

controls.title: Ensure dhcp server services are not in use
controls.description:
\

\f2\b0 The Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) is a service that allows machines to\
be dynamically assigned IP addresses. There are two versions of the DHCP protocol\

\f0 \cf4 DHCPv4
\f2 \cf2  and 
\f0 \cf4 DHCPv6
\f2 \cf2 . At startup the server may be started for one or the other via the 
\f0 \cf4 -4\

\f2 \cf2 or 
\f0 \cf4 -6
\f2 \cf2  arguments.\

\f1\b
controls.rationale:
\

\f2\b0 Unless a system is specifically set up to act as a DHCP server, it is recommended that\
the 
\f0 \cf4 dhcp-server
\f2 \cf2  package be removed to reduce the potential attack surface.\

\f1\b
controls.impact:
\

\f2\b0 There may be packages that are dependent on the 
\f0 \cf4 dhcp-server
\f2 \cf2  package. If the 
\f0 \cf4 dhcp-\
server
\f2 \cf2  package is removed, these dependent packages will be removed as well.\
Before removing the 
\f0 \cf4 dhcp-server
\f2 \cf2  package, review any dependent package
controls.audit_command:
\

\f2\b0 Run the following command to verify 
\f0 \cf4 dhcp-server
\f2 \cf2  is not installed:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # rpm -q dhcp-server\
package dhcp-server is not installed\

\f1\b\fs24 - OR -\
- IF -
\f2\b0  the package is required for dependencies:\
Run the following command to verify 
\f0 \cf4 dhcpd.service
\f2 \cf2  and 
\f0 \cf4 dhcpd6.service
\f2 \cf2  are not\
enabled:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl is-enabled dhcpd.service dhcpd6.service 2>/dev/null | grep\
'enabled'\
Nothing
controls.remediation:
\

\f2\b0 Run the following commands to stop 
\f0 \cf4 dhcpd.service
\f2 \cf2  and 
\f0 \cf4 dhcpd6.service
\f2 \cf2  and\
remove 
\f0 \cf4 dhcp-server
\f2 \cf2  package:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl stop dhcpd.service dhcpd6.service\
# dnf remove dhcp-server\

\f1\b\fs24 - OR -\
- IF -
\f2\b0  the 
\f0 \cf4 dhcp-server
\f2 \cf2  package is required as a dependency:\
Run the following commands to stop and mask 
\f0 \cf4 dhcpd.service
\f2 \cf2  and 
\f0 \cf4 dhcpd6.service
\f2 \cf2 :\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl stop dhcpd.service dhcpd6.service\
# systemctl mask dhcpd.service dhcpd6.service\

\f1\b\fs24
controls.references:
\

\f2\b0 1. dhcpd(8)\
2. NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 5: CM-7
\fs20\fsmilli10080 Page 299\

\f0 Internal Only - General\

\f1\b\fs24

controls.title: Ensure dns server services are not in use
controls.description:
\

\f2\b0 The Domain Name System (DNS) is a hierarchical naming system that maps names to\
IP addresses for computers, services and other resources connected to a network.\

\f1\b
controls.rationale:
\

\f2\b0 Unless a system is specifically designated to act as a DNS server, it is recommended\
that the package be removed to reduce the potential attack surface.\

\f1\b
controls.impact:
\

\f2\b0 There may be packages that are dependent on the 
\f0 \cf4 bind
\f2 \cf2  package. If the 
\f0 \cf4 bind
\f2 \cf2  package\
is removed, these dependent packages will be removed as well. Before removing the\

\f0 \cf4 bind
\f2 \cf2  package, review any dependent packages to determine if they
controls.audit_command:
\

\f2\b0 Run one of the following commands to verify 
\f0 \cf4 bind
\f2 \cf2  is not installed:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # rpm -q bind\
package bind is not installed\

\f1\b\fs24 - OR -\
- IF -
\f2\b0  the package is required for dependencies:\
Run the following command to verify 
\f0 \cf4 named.service
\f2 \cf2  is not enabled:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl is-enabled named.service 2>/dev/null | grep 'enabled'\
Nothing should be returned\

\f2\fs24 Run the following command to verify the
controls.remediation:
\

\f2\b0 Run the following commands to stop 
\f0 \cf4 named.service
\f2 \cf2  and remove 
\f0 \cf4 bind
\f2 \cf2  package:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl stop named.service\
# dnf remove bind\

\f1\b\fs24 - OR -\
- IF -
\f2\b0  the 
\f0 \cf4 bind
\f2 \cf2  package is required as a dependency:\
Run the following commands to stop and mask 
\f0 \cf4 named.service
\f2 \cf2 :\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl stop named.service\
# systemctl mask named.service\

\f1\b\fs24
controls.references:
\

\f2\b0 1. NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 5: CM-7
\fs20\fsmilli10080 Page 302\

\f0 Internal Only - General\

\f1\b\fs24

controls.title: Ensure dnsmasq services are not in use
controls.description:
\

\f0\b0 \cf4 dnsmasq
\f2 \cf2  is a lightweight tool that provides DNS caching, DNS forwarding and DHCP\
(Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol) services.\

\f1\b
controls.rationale:
\

\f2\b0 Unless a system is specifically designated to act as a DNS caching, DNS forwarding\
and/or DHCP server, it is recommended that the package be removed to reduce the\
potential attack surface.\

\f1\b
controls.impact:
\

\f2\b0 There may be packages that are dependent on the 
\f0 \cf4 dnsmasq
\f2 \cf2  package. If the 
\f0 \cf4 dnsmasq\

\f2 \cf2 package is removed, these dependent packages will be removed as well. Before\
removing the 
\f0 \cf4 dnsmasq
\f2 \cf2  package, review any dependent packages to determin
controls.audit_command:
\

\f2\b0 Run one of the following commands to verify 
\f0 \cf4 dnsmasq
\f2 \cf2  is not installed:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # rpm -q dnsmasq\
package dnsmasq is not installed\

\f1\b\fs24 - OR -\
- IF -
\f2\b0  the package is required for dependencies:\
Run the following command to verify 
\f0 \cf4 dnsmasq.service
\f2 \cf2  is not enabled:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl is-enabled dnsmasq.service 2>/dev/null | grep 'enabled'\
Nothing should be returned\

\f2\fs24 Run the following command t
controls.remediation:
\

\f2\b0 Run the following commands to stop 
\f0 \cf4 dnsmasq.service
\f2 \cf2  and remove 
\f0 \cf4 dnsmasq
\f2 \cf2  package:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl stop dnsmasq.service\
# dnf remove dnsmasq\

\f1\b\fs24 - OR -\
- IF -
\f2\b0  the 
\f0 \cf4 dnsmasq
\f2 \cf2  package is required as a dependency:\
Run the following commands to stop and mask the 
\f0 \cf4 dnsmasq.service
\f2 \cf2 :\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl stop dnsmasq.service\
# systemctl mask dnsmasq.service\

\f1\b\fs24
controls.references:
\

\f2\b0 1. NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 5: CM-7\

\f1\b

controls.title: Ensure ftp server services are not in use
controls.description:
\

\f2\b0 FTP (File Transfer Protocol) is a traditional and widely used standard tool for\
transferring files between a server and clients over a network, especially where no\
authentication is necessary (permits anonymous users to connect to a server).\

\f1\b
controls.rationale:
\

\f2\b0 Unless there is a need to run the system as a FTP server, it is recommended that the\
package be removed to reduce the potential attack surface.\

\f1\b
controls.impact:
\

\f2\b0 There may be packages that are dependent on the 
\f0 \cf4 vsftpd
\f2 \cf2  package. If the 
\f0 \cf4 vsftpd\

\f2 \cf2 package is removed, these dependent packages will be removed as well. Before\
removing the 
\f0 \cf4 vsftpd
\f2 \cf2  package, review any dependent packages to determine i
controls.audit_command:
\

\f2\b0 Run the following command to verify 
\f0 \cf4 vsftpd
\f2 \cf2  is not installed:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # rpm -q vsftpd\
package vsftpd is not installed\

\f1\b\fs24 - OR -\
- IF -
\f2\b0  the package is required for dependencies:\
Run the following command to verify 
\f0 \cf4 vsftpd
\f2 \cf2  service is not enabled:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl is-enabled vsftpd.service 2>/dev/null | grep 'enabled'\
Nothing should be returned\

\f2\fs24 Run the following command to verify the
controls.remediation:
\

\f2\b0 Run the following commands to stop 
\f0 \cf4 vsftpd.service
\f2 \cf2  and remove 
\f0 \cf4 vsftpd
\f2 \cf2  package:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl stop vsftpd.service\
# dnf remove vsftpd\

\f1\b\fs24 - OR -\
- IF -
\f2\b0  the 
\f0 \cf4 vsftpd
\f2 \cf2  package is required as a dependency:\
Run the following commands to stop and mask the 
\f0 \cf4 vsftpd.service
\f2 \cf2 :\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl stop vsftpd.service\
# systemctl mask vsftpd.service\

\f1\b\fs24 Note:
\f2\b0  Other ftp server packages may exist. If not required and authorized by local site\
policy, they should also be removed. If the package is required for a dependency, the\
service should be stopped and masked.\

\f1\b
controls.references:
\

\f2\b0 1. NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 5: CM-7\
2. NIST SP 800-53A :: CM-6.1 (iv)\
3. RHEL 8 STIG Vul ID: V-230558\
4. RHEL 8 STIG Rule ID: SV-230558r627750
\fs20\fsmilli10080 Page 307\

\f0 Internal Only - General\

\f1\b\fs24

controls.title: Ensure message access server services are not in use\
controls.description:
\

\f0\b0 \cf4 dovecot
\f2 \cf2  and 
\f0 \cf4 cyrus-imapd
\f2 \cf2  are open source IMAP and POP3 server packages for Linux\
based systems.\

\f1\b
controls.rationale:
\

\f2\b0 Unless POP3 and/or IMAP servers are to be provided by this system, it is\
recommended that the package be removed to reduce the potential attack surface.\

\f1\b Note:
\f2\b0  Several IMAP/POP3 servers exist and can use other service names. These\
should also be
controls.impact:
\

\f2\b0 There may be packages that are dependent on 
\f0 \cf4 dovecot
\f2 \cf2  and 
\f0 \cf4 cyrus-imapd
\f2 \cf2  packages. If\

\f0 \cf4 dovecot
\f2 \cf2  and 
\f0 \cf4 cyrus-imapd
\f2 \cf2  packages are removed, these dependent packages will be\
removed as well. Before removing 
\f0 \cf4 dovec
controls.audit_command:
\

\f2\b0 Run the following command to verify 
\f0 \cf4 dovecot
\f2 \cf2  and 
\f0 \cf4 cyrus-imapd
\f2 \cf2  are not installed:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # rpm -q dovecot cyrus-imapd\
package dovecot is not installed\
package cyrus-imapd is not installed\

\f1\b\fs24 - OR -\
- IF -
\f2\b0  a package is installed 
\f1\b and
\f2\b0  is required for dependencies:\
Run the following commands to verify 
\f0 \cf4 dovecot.socket
\f2 \cf2 , 
\f0 \cf4 dovecot.service
\f2 \cf2 , and\

\f0 \cf4 cyrus-imapd.
controls.remediation:
\

\f2\b0 Run the following commands to stop 
\f0 \cf4 dovecot.socket
\f2 \cf2 , 
\f0 \cf4 dovecot.service
\f2 \cf2 , and 
\f0 \cf4 cyrus-\
imapd.service
\f2 \cf2 , and remove 
\f0 \cf4 dovecot
\f2 \cf2  and 
\f0 \cf4 cyrus-imapd
\f2 \cf2  packages:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl stop dovecot.socket dovecot.service cyrus-imapd.service\
# dnf remove dovecot cyrus-imapd\

\f1\b\fs24 - OR -\
- IF -
\f2\b0  a package is installed 
\f1\b and
\f2\b0  is required for dependencies:\
Run the following commands to stop and mask 
\f0 \cf4 dovecot.socket
\f2 \cf2 , 
\f0 \cf4 dovecot.service
\f2 \cf2 ,\
and 
\f0 \cf4 cyrus-imapd.service
\f2 \cf2 :\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl stop dovecot.socket dovecot.service cyrus-imapd.service\
# systemctl mask dovecot.socket dovecot.service cyrus-imapd
controls.references:
\

\f2\b0 1. NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 5: CM-7
\fs20\fsmilli10080 Page 310\

\f0 Internal Only - General\

\f1\b\fs24

controls.title: Ensure network file system services are not in use\
controls.description:
\

\f2\b0 The Network File System (NFS) is one of the first and most widely distributed file\
systems in the UNIX environment. It provides the ability for systems to mount file\
systems of other servers through the network.\

\f1\b
controls.rationale:
\

\f2\b0 If the system does not require access to network shares or the ability to provide network\
file system services for other host's network shares, it is recommended that the 
\f0 \cf4 nfs-\
utils
\f2 \cf2  package be removed to reduce the attack surface of the system.\

\f1\b
controls.impact:
\

\f2\b0 Many of the 
\f0 \cf4 libvirt
\f2 \cf2  packages used by Enterprise Linux virtualization are dependent\
on the 
\f0 \cf4 nfs-utils
\f2 \cf2  package. If the 
\f0 \cf4 nfs-utils
\f2 \cf2  package is removed, these dependent\
packages will be removed as well. Before removing the 
\f0 \cf4 nf
controls.audit_command:
\

\f2\b0 Run the following command to verify 
\f0 \cf4 nfs-utils
\f2 \cf2  is not installed:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # rpm -q nfs-utils\
package nfs-utils is not installed\

\f1\b\fs24 - OR -
\f2\b0  If package is required for dependencies:\
Run the following command to verify that the 
\f0 \cf4 nfs-server.service
\f2 \cf2  is not enabled:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl is-enabled nfs-server.service 2>/dev/null | grep 'enabled'\
Nothing should be returned\

\f2\fs24 Run the following comma
controls.remediation:
\

\f2\b0 Run the following command to stop 
\f0 \cf4 nfs-server.service
\f2 \cf2  and remove 
\f0 \cf4 nfs-utils\

\f2 \cf2 package:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl stop nfs-server.service\
# dnf remove nfs-utils\

\f1\b\fs24 - OR -\
- IF -
\f2\b0  the 
\f0 \cf4 nfs-utils
\f2 \cf2  package is required as a dependency:\
Run the following commands to stop and mask the 
\f0 \cf4 nfs-server.service
\f2 \cf2 :\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl stop nfs-server.service\
# systemctl mask nfs-server.service\

\f1\b\fs24
controls.references:
\

\f2\b0 1. NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 5: CM-6, CM-7\

\f1\b

controls.title: Ensure nis server services are not in use
controls.description:
\

\f2\b0 The Network Information Service (NIS), formerly known as Yellow Pages, is a client-\
server directory service protocol used to distribute system configuration files. The NIS\
client ( 
\f0 \cf4 ypbind
\f2 \cf2  ) was used to bind a machine to an NIS server and receive the\
distributed configuration files.\

\f1\b
controls.rationale:
\

\f2\b0 The NIS service is inherently an insecure system that has been vulnerable to DOS\
attacks, buffer overflows and has poor authentication for querying NIS maps. NIS\
generally has been replaced by such protocols as Lightweight Directory Access\
Protocol (LDAP). It is recommended that the service be removed.\

\f1\b
controls.impact:
\

\f2\b0 There may be packages that are dependent on the 
\f0 \cf4 ypserv
\f2 \cf2  package. If the 
\f0 \cf4 ypserv\

\f2 \cf2 package is removed, these dependent packages will be removed as well. Before\
removing the 
\f0 \cf4 ypserv
\f2 \cf2  package, review any dependent packages to determine i
controls.audit_command:
\

\f2\b0 Run the following command to verify 
\f0 \cf4 ypserv
\f2 \cf2  is not installed:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # rpm -q ypserv\
package ypserv is not installed\

\f1\b\fs24 - OR -\
- IF -
\f2\b0  the package is required for dependencies:\
Run the following command to verify

\f1\b\fs24

controls.title: Ensure print server services are not in use
controls.description:
\

\f2\b0 The Common Unix Print System (CUPS) provides the ability to print to both local and\
network printers. A system running CUPS can also accept print jobs from remote\
systems and print them to local printers. It also provides a web based remote\
administration capability.\

\f1\b
controls.rationale:
\

\f2\b0 If the system does not need to print jobs or accept print jobs from other systems, it is\
recommended that CUPS be removed to reduce the potential attack surface.\

\f1\b
controls.impact:
\

\f2\b0 Removing the cups package, or disabling 
\f0 \cf4 cups.socket
\f2 \cf2  and/or 
\f0 \cf4 cups.service
\f2 \cf2  will\
prevent printing from the system, a common task for workstation systems.\
There may be packages that are dependent on the 
\f0 \cf4 cups
\f2 \cf2  package. If the 
\f0 \cf4
controls.audit_command:
\

\f2\b0 Run the following command to verify 
\f0 \cf4 cups
\f2 \cf2  is not installed:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # rpm -q cups\
package cups is not installed\

\f1\b\fs24 - OR -\
- IF -
\f2\b0  the 
\f0 \cf4 cups
\f2 \cf2  package is required as a dependency:\
Run the following command to verify the 
\f0 \cf4 cups.socket
\f2 \cf2  and 
\f0 \cf4 cups.service
\f2 \cf2  are not\
enabled:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl is-enabled cups.socket cups.service 2>/dev/null | grep 'enabled'\
Nothing sh
controls.remediation:
\

\f2\b0 Run the following commands to stop 
\f0 \cf4 cups.socket
\f2 \cf2  and 
\f0 \cf4 cups.service
\f2 \cf2 , and remove the\

\f0 \cf4 cups
\f2 \cf2  package:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl stop cups.socket cups.service\
# dnf remove cups\

\f1\b\fs24 - OR -\
- IF -
\f2\b0  the 
\f0 \cf4 cups
\f2 \cf2  package is required as a dependency:\
Run the following commands to stop and mask the 
\f0 \cf4 cups.socket
\f2 \cf2  and 
\f0 \cf4 cups.service
\f2 \cf2 :\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl stop cups.socket cups.service\
# systemctl mask cups.socket cups.service\

\

\fs20\fsmilli10080 Page 319\

\f0 Internal Only - General\

\f1\b\fs24

controls.title: Ensure rpcbind services are not in use
controls.description:
\

\f2\b0 The 
\f0 \cf4 rpcbind
\f2 \cf2  utility maps RPC services to the ports on which they listen. RPC\
processes notify 
\f0 \cf4 rpcbind
\f2 \cf2  when they start, registering the ports they are listening on and\
the RPC program numbers they expect to serve. The client system then contacts\

\f0 \cf4 rpcbind
\f2 \cf2  on the server with a particular RPC program number. The 
\f0 \cf4 rpcbind.service\

\f2 \cf2 redirects the client to the proper port number so it can communicate with the req
controls.rationale:
\

\f2\b0 A small request (~82 bytes via UDP) sent to the Portmapper generates a large\
response (7x to 28x amplification), which makes it a suitable tool for DDoS attacks. If\

\f0 \cf4 rpcbind
\f2 \cf2  is not required, it is recommended to remove 
\f0 \cf4 rpcbind
\f2 \cf2  package to reduce the\
potential attack surface.\

\f1\b
controls.impact:
\

\f2\b0 Many of the libvirt packages used by Enterprise Linux virtualization, and the 
\f0 \cf4 nfs-utils\

\f2 \cf2 package used for The Network File System (NFS), are dependent on the 
\f0 \cf4 rpcbind\

\f2 \cf2 package. If the 
\f0 \cf4 rpcbind
\f2 \cf2  package is removed, these dependent pac
controls.audit_command:
\

\f2\b0 Run the following command to verify 
\f0 \cf4 rpcbind
\f2 \cf2  package is not installed:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # rpm -q rpcbind\
package rpcbind is not installed\

\f1\b\fs24 - OR -\
- IF -
\f2\b0  the 
\f0 \cf4 rpcbind
\f2 \cf2  package is required as a dependency:\
Run the following command to verify 
\f0 \cf4 rpcbind.socket
\f2 \cf2  and 
\f0 \cf4 rpcbind.service
\f2 \cf2  are not\
enabled:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl is-enabled rpcbind.socket rpcbind.service 2>/dev/null
controls.remediation:
\

\f2\b0 Run the following commands to stop 
\f0 \cf4 rpcbind.socket
\f2 \cf2  and 
\f0 \cf4 rpcbind.service
\f2 \cf2 , and\
remove the 
\f0 \cf4 rpcbind
\f2 \cf2  package:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl stop rpcbind.socket rpcbind.service\
# dnf remove rpcbind\

\f1\b\fs24 - OR -\
- IF -
\f2\b0  the 
\f0 \cf4 rpcbind
\f2 \cf2  package is required as a dependency:\
Run the following commands to stop and mask the 
\f0 \cf4 rpcbind.socket
\f2 \cf2  and\

\f0 \cf4 rpcbind.service
\f2 \cf2 :\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl stop rpcbind.socket rpcbind.service\
# systemctl mask rpcbind.socket rpcbind.service\

\fs20\fsmilli10080 Page 322\

\f1\b\fs24

controls.title: Ensure rsync services are not in use
controls.description:
\

\f2\b0 The 
\f0 \cf4 rsyncd.service
\f2 \cf2  can be used to synchronize files between systems over network\
links.\

\f1\b
controls.rationale:
\

\f2\b0 Unless required, the 
\f0 \cf4 rsync-daemon
\f2 \cf2  package should be removed to reduce the potential\
attack surface.\
The 
\f0 \cf4 rsyncd.service
\f2 \cf2  presents a security risk as it uses unencrypted protocols for\
communication.\

\f1\b
controls.impact:
\

\f2\b0 There may be packages that are dependent on the 
\f0 \cf4 rsync-daemon
\f2 \cf2  package. If the\

\f0 \cf4 rsync-daemon
\f2 \cf2  package is removed, these dependent packages will be removed as\
well. Before removing the 
\f0 \cf4 rsync-daemon
\f2 \cf2  package, review any dependent packa
controls.audit_command:
\

\f2\b0 Run the following command to verify the 
\f0 \cf4 rsync-daemon
\f2 \cf2  package is not installed:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # rpm -q rsync-daemon\
package rsync-daemon is not installed\

\f1\b\fs24 - OR -\
- IF -
\f2\b0  the 
\f0 \cf4 rsync-daemon
\f2 \cf2  package is required as a dependency:\
Run the following command to verify 
\f0 \cf4 rsyncd.socket
\f2 \cf2  and 
\f0 \cf4 rsyncd.service
\f2 \cf2  are not\
enabled:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl is-enabled rsyncd.socket rsyncd.
controls.remediation:
\

\f2\b0 Run the following commands to stop 
\f0 \cf4 rsyncd.socket
\f2 \cf2  and 
\f0 \cf4 rsyncd.service
\f2 \cf2 , and\
remove the 
\f0 \cf4 rsync-daemon
\f2 \cf2  package:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl stop rsyncd.socket rsyncd.service\
# dnf remove rsync-daemon\

\f1\b\fs24 - OR -\
- IF -
\f2\b0  the 
\f0 \cf4 rsync-daemon
\f2 \cf2  package is required as a dependency:\
Run the following commands to stop and mask the 
\f0 \cf4 rsyncd.socket
\f2 \cf2  and\

\f0 \cf4 rsyncd.service
\f2 \cf2 :\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl stop rsyncd.socket rsyncd.service\
# systemctl mask rsyncd.socket rsyncd.service\

\fs20\fsmilli10080 Page 325\

\f1\b\fs24

controls.title: Ensure samba file server services are not in use\
controls.description:
\

\f2\b0 The Samba daemon allows system administrators to configure their Linux systems to\
share file systems and directories with Windows desktops. Samba will advertise the file\
systems and directories via the Server Message Block (SMB) protocol. Windows\
desktop users will be able to mount these directories and file systems as letter drives on\
their systems.\

\f1\b
controls.rationale:
\

\f2\b0 If there is no need to mount directories and file systems to Windows systems, then this\
package can be removed to reduce the potential attack surface.\

\f1\b
controls.impact:
\

\f2\b0 There may be packages that are dependent on the 
\f0 \cf4 samba
\f2 \cf2  package. If the 
\f0 \cf4 samba\

\f2 \cf2 package is removed, these dependent packages will be removed as well. Before\
removing the 
\f0 \cf4 samba
\f2 \cf2  package, review any dependent packages to determine if t
controls.audit_command:
\

\f2\b0 Run the following command to verify 
\f0 \cf4 samba
\f2 \cf2  package is not installed:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # rpm -q samba\
package samba is not installed\

\f1\b\fs24 - OR -\
- IF -
\f2\b0  the package is required for dependencies:\
Run the following command to verify 
\f0 \cf4 smb.service
\f2 \cf2  is not enabled:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl is-enabled smb.service 2>/dev/null | grep 'enabled'\
Nothing should be returned\

\f2\fs24 Run the following command to verify the
controls.remediation:
\

\f2\b0 Run the following command to stop 
\f0 \cf4 smb.service
\f2 \cf2  and remove 
\f0 \cf4 samba
\f2 \cf2  package:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl stop smb.service\
# dnf remove samba\

\f1\b\fs24 - OR -\
- IF -
\f2\b0  the 
\f0 \cf4 samba
\f2 \cf2  package is required as a dependency:\
Run the following commands to stop and mask the 
\f0 \cf4 smb.service
\f2 \cf2 :\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl stop smb.service\
# systemctl mask smb.service\

\fs20\fsmilli10080 Page 328\

\f0 Internal Only - General\

\f1\b\fs24

controls.title: Ensure snmp services are not in use
controls.description:
\

\f2\b0 Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) is a widely used protocol for monitoring\
the health and welfare of network equipment, computer equipment and devices like\
UPSs.\
Net-SNMP is a suite of applications used to implement SNMPv1 (RFC 1157), SNMPv2\
(RFCs 1901-1908), and SNMPv3 (RFCs 3411-3418) using both IPv4 and IPv6.\
Support for SNMPv2 classic (a.k.a. "SNMPv2 historic" - RFCs 1441-1452) was dropped\
with the 4.0 release of the UCD-snmp package.\
The Simple Network Management Pr
controls.rationale:
\

\f2\b0 The SNMP server can communicate using 
\f0 \cf4 SNMPv1
\f2 \cf2 , which transmits data in the clear\
and does not require authentication to execute commands. 
\f0 \cf4 SNMPv3
\f2 \cf2  replaces the\
simple/clear text password sharing used in 
\f0 \cf4 SNMPv2
\f2 \cf2  with more securely encoded\
parameters. If the the SNMP service is not required, the 
\f0 \cf4 net-snmp
\f2 \cf2  package should be\
removed to reduce the attack surface of the system.\

\f1\b Note:
\f2\b0  If SNMP is req
controls.impact:
\

\f2\b0 There may be packages that are dependent on the 
\f0 \cf4 net-snmp
\f2 \cf2  package. If the 
\f0 \cf4 net-snmp\

\f2 \cf2 package is removed, these packages will be removed as well.\
Before removing the 
\f0 \cf4 net-snmp
\f2 \cf2  package, review any dependent packages to determine\
if t
controls.audit_command:
\

\f2\b0 Run the following command to verify 
\f0 \cf4 net-snmp
\f2 \cf2  package is not installed:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # rpm -q net-snmp\
package net-snmp is not installed\

\f1\b\fs24 - OR -
\f2\b0  If the package is required for dependencies:\
Run the following command to verify the 
\f0 \cf4 snmpd.service
\f2 \cf2  is not enabled:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl is-enabled snmpd.service 2>/dev/null | grep 'enabled'\
Nothing should be returned\

\f2\fs24 Run the following command to
controls.remediation:
\

\f2\b0 Run the following commands to stop 
\f0 \cf4 snmpd.service
\f2 \cf2  and remove 
\f0 \cf4 net-snmp
\f2 \cf2  package:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl stop snmpd.service\
# dnf remove net-snmp\

\f1\b\fs24 - OR -
\f2\b0  If the package is required for dependencies:\
Run the following commands to stop and mask the 
\f0 \cf4 snmpd.service
\f2 \cf2 :\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl stop snmpd.service\
# systemctl mask snmpd.service\

controls.references:
\

\f2\b0 1. NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 5: CM-7
\fs20\fsmilli10080 Page 331\

\f0 Internal Only - General\

\f1\b\fs24

controls.title: Ensure telnet server services are not in use
controls.description:
\

\f2\b0 The 
\f0 \cf4 telnet-server
\f2 \cf2  package contains the 
\f0 \cf4 telnet
\f2 \cf2  daemon, which accepts connections\
from users from other systems via the 
\f0 \cf4 telnet
\f2 \cf2  protocol.\

\f1\b
controls.rationale:
\

\f2\b0 The 
\f0 \cf4 telnet
\f2 \cf2  protocol is insecure and unencrypted. The use of an unencrypted\
transmission medium could allow a user with access to sniff network traffic the ability to\
steal credentials. The 
\f0 \cf4 ssh
\f2 \cf2  package provides an encrypted session and stronger\
security.\

\f1\b
controls.impact:
\

\f2\b0 There may be packages that are dependent on the 
\f0 \cf4 telnet-server
\f2 \cf2  package. If the\

\f0 \cf4 telnet-server
\f2 \cf2  package is removed, these dependent packages will be removed as\
well. Before removing the 
\f0 \cf4 telnet-server
\f2 \cf2  package, review any dependent pa
controls.audit_command:
\

\f2\b0 Run the following command to verify the 
\f0 \cf4 telnet-server
\f2 \cf2  package is not installed:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 rpm -q telnet-server\
package telnet-server is not installed\

\f1\b\fs24 - OR -\
- IF -
\f2\b0  a package is installed 
\f1\b and
\f2\b0  is required for dependencies:\
Run the following command to verify 
\f0 \cf4 telnet.socket
\f2 \cf2  is not enabled:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl is-enabled telnet.socket 2>/dev/null | grep 'enabled'\
Nothing should be r
controls.remediation:
\

\f2\b0 Run the following commands to stop 
\f0 \cf4 telnet.socket
\f2 \cf2  and remove the 
\f0 \cf4 telnet-server\

\f2 \cf2 package:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl stop telnet.socket\
# dnf remove telnet-server\

\f1\b\fs24 - OR -\
- IF -
\f2\b0  a package is installed 
\f1\b and
\f2\b0  is required for dependencies:\
Run the following commands to stop and mask 
\f0 \cf4 telnet.socket
\f2 \cf2 :\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl stop telnet.socket\
# systemctl mask telnet.socket\

\f1\b\fs24
controls.references:
\

\f2\b0 1. NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 5: CM-7, CM-11\
2. NIST SP 800-53A :: CM-7.1 (ii)\
3. RHEL 8 STIG Vul ID: V-230487\
4. RHEL 8 STIG Rule ID: SV-230487r627750
\fs20\fsmilli10080 Page 334\

\f0 Internal Only - General\

\f1\b\fs24

controls.title: Ensure tftp server services are not in use
controls.description:
\

\f2\b0 Trivial File Transfer Protocol (TFTP) is a simple protocol for exchanging files between\
two TCP/IP machines. TFTP servers allow connections from a TFTP Client for sending\
and receiving files.\

\f1\b
controls.rationale:
\

\f2\b0 Unless there is a need to run the system as a TFTP server, it is recommended that the\
package be removed to reduce the potential attack surface.\
TFTP does not have built-in encryption, access control or authentication. This makes it\
very easy for an attacker to exploit TFTP to gain access to files\

\f1\b
controls.impact:
\

\f2\b0 TFTP is often used to provide files for network booting such as for PXE based\
installation of servers.\
There may be packages that are dependent on the 
\f0 \cf4 tftp-server
\f2 \cf2  package. If the 
\f0 \cf4 tftp-\
server
\f2 \cf2  package is removed, these dependent packages will be re
controls.audit_command:
\

\f2\b0 Run the following command to verify 
\f0 \cf4 tftp-server
\f2 \cf2  is not installed:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # rpm -q tftp-server\
package tftp-server is not installed\

\f1\b\fs24 - OR -\
- IF -
\f2\b0  the package is required for dependencies:\
Run the following command to verify 
\f0 \cf4 tftp.socket
\f2 \cf2  and 
\f0 \cf4 tftp.service
\f2 \cf2  are not enabled:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl is-enabled tftp.socket tftp.service 2>/dev/null | grep 'enabled'\
Nothing should be
controls.remediation:
\

\f2\b0 Run the following commands to stop 
\f0 \cf4 tftp.socket
\f2 \cf2  and 
\f0 \cf4 tftp.service
\f2 \cf2 , and remove the\

\f0 \cf4 tftp-server
\f2 \cf2  package:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl stop tftp.socket tftp.service\
# dnf remove tftp-server\

\f1\b\fs24 - OR -\
- IF -
\f2\b0  the 
\f0 \cf4 tftp-server
\f2 \cf2  package is required as a dependency:\
Run the following commands to stop and mask 
\f0 \cf4 tftp.socket
\f2 \cf2  and 
\f0 \cf4 tftp.service
\f2 \cf2 :\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl stop tftp.socket tftp.service\
# systemctl mask tftp.socket tftp.service\

\

\f2\b0 1. NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 5: CM-7
\fs20\fsmilli10080 Page 337\

\f0 Internal Only - General\

\f1\b\fs24

controls.title: Ensure web proxy server services are not in use\
controls.description:
\

\f2\b0 Squid is a standard proxy server used in many distributions and environments.\

\f1\b
controls.rationale:
\

\f2\b0 Unless a system is specifically set up to act as a proxy server, it is recommended that\
the squid package be removed to reduce the potential attack surface.\

\f1\b Note:
\f2\b0  Several HTTP proxy servers exist. These should be checked and removed unless\
required.\

\f1\b
controls.impact:
\

\f2\b0 There may be packages that are dependent on the 
\f0 \cf4 squid
\f2 \cf2  package. If the 
\f0 \cf4 squid\

\f2 \cf2 package is removed, these dependent packages will be removed as well. Before\
removing the 
\f0 \cf4 squid
\f2 \cf2  package, review any dependent packages to determine if t
controls.remediation:
\

\f2\b0 Run the following commands to stop 
\f0 \cf4 squid.service
\f2 \cf2  and remove the 
\f0 \cf4 squid
\f2 \cf2  package:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl stop squid.service\
# dnf remove squid\

\f1\b\fs24 - OR -
\f2\b0  If the 
\f0 \cf4 squid
\f2 \cf2  package is required as a dependency:\
Run the following commands to stop and mask the 
\f0 \cf4 squid.service
\f2 \cf2 :\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl stop squid.service\
# systemctl mask squid.service\

\f1\b\fs24
controls.references:
\

\f2\b0 1. NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 5: CM-6, CM-7\

\f1\b

controls.title: Ensure web server services are not in use
controls.description:
\

\f2\b0 Web servers provide the ability to host web site content.\

\f1\b
controls.rationale:
\

\f2\b0 Unless there is a local site approved requirement to run a web server service on the\
system, web server packages should be removed to reduce the potential attack surface.\

\f1\b
controls.impact:
\

\f2\b0 Removal of a web server's package, or changing the state of its service and/or socket,\
will prevent the server from hosting web services.\

\f1\b - IF -
\f2\b0  a web server package is required for a dependency, any related service or socket\
should be stopped and masked.\

\f1\b Note:
\f
controls.audit_command:
\

\f0 \cf4 httpd
\f2 \cf2  and 
\f0 \cf4 nginx
\f2 \cf2  are not installed:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # rpm -q httpd nginx\
package httpd is not installed\
package nginx is not installed\

- IF -
\f2\b0  a package is installed 
\f1\b and
\f2\b0  is required for dependencies:\

Run the following command to verify 
\f0 \cf4 httpd.socket
\f2 \cf2  and 
\f0 \cf4 httpd.s
controls.remediation:
steps to mask a service are followed and that package is not\
installed on the system, the service and/or socket will still be masked. If the package is\
installed due to an approved requirement to host a web server, the associated service\
and/or socket would need to be unmasked before it could be enabled and/or started.
\fs20\fsmilli10080 Page 342\

controls.references:
\

\f2\b0 1. NIST SP 800-53 :: CM-7
\fs20\fsmilli10080 Page 344\

\f0 Internal Only - General\

\f1\b\fs24

controls.title: Ensure xinetd services are not in use
controls.description:
\

\f2\b0 The eXtended InterNET Daemon (
\f0 \cf4 xinetd
\f2 \cf2 ) is an open source super daemon that\
replaced the original 
\f0 \cf4 inetd
\f2 \cf2  daemon. The 
\f0 \cf4 xinetd
\f2 \cf2  daemon listens for well known\
services and dispatches the appropriate daemon to properly respond to service\
requests.\

\f1\b
controls.rationale:
\

\f2\b0 If there are no 
\f0 \cf4 xinetd
\f2 \cf2  services required, it is recommended that the package be\
removed to reduce the attack surface are of the system.\

\f1\b Note:
\f2\b0  If an 
\f0 \cf4 xinetd
\f2 \cf2  service or services are required, ensure that any 
\f0 \cf4 xinetd
\f2 \cf2  service not\
required is stopped and masked\

\f1\b
controls.impact:
\

\f2\b0 There may be packages that are dependent on the 
\f0 \cf4 xinetd
\f2 \cf2  package. If the 
\f0 \cf4 xinetd\

\f2 \cf2 package is removed, these dependent packages will be removed as well. Before\
removing the 
\f0 \cf4 xinetd
\f2 \cf2  package, review any dependent packages to determine i
controls.audit_command:
\

\f2\b0 Run the following command to verify the 
\f0 \cf4 xinetd
\f2 \cf2  package is not installed:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # rpm -q xinetd\
package xinetd is not installed\

\f1\b\fs24 - OR -\
- IF -
\f2\b0  the 
\f0 \cf4 xinetd
\f2 \cf2  package is required as a dependency:\
Run the following command to verify 
\f0 \cf4 xinetd.service
\f2 \cf2  is not enabled:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl is-enabled xinetd.service 2>/dev/null | grep 'enabled'\
Nothing should be returned\

\f2\fs24 Ru
controls.remediation:
\

\f2\b0 Run the following commands to stop 
\f0 \cf4 xinetd.service
\f2 \cf2 , and remove the 
\f0 \cf4 xinetd\

\f2 \cf2 package:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl stop xinetd.service\
# dnf remove xinetd\

\f1\b\fs24 - OR -\
- IF -
\f2\b0  the 
\f0 \cf4 xinetd
\f2 \cf2  package is required as a dependency:\
Run the following commands to stop and mask the 
\f0 \cf4 xinetd.service
\f2 \cf2 :\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # systemctl stop xinetd.service\
# systemctl mask xinetd.service\

\f1\b\fs24
controls.references:
\

\f2\b0 1. NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 5: CM-7
\fs20\fsmilli10080 Page 347\

\f0 Internal Only - General\

\f1\b\fs24

controls.title: Ensure GNOME Display Manager is removed
controls.description:
\

\f2\b0 The GNOME Display Manager (GDM) is a program that manages graphical display\
servers and handles graphical user logins.\

\f1\b
controls.rationale:
\

\f2\b0 If a Graphical User Interface (GUI) is not required, it should be removed to reduce the\
attack surface of the system.\

\f1\b
controls.impact:
\

\f2\b0 Removing the GNOME Display manager will remove the Graphical User Interface (GUI)\
from the system.\

\f1\b
controls.audit_command:
\

\f2\b0 Run the following command to verify the 
\f0 \cf4 Installed Environment Group
\f2 \cf2  is not\

\f0 \cf4 Server with GUI
\f2 \cf2 :\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # dnf grouplist | sed -n '/Installed Environment Groups:/,/Installed\
Groups:/p'\

\f3\i\fs24 Example output:\

\f4\i0\fs20\fsmilli10080 Installed Environment Groups:\
Server\
Installed Groups:
\f2 Page 349\

\f0 Internal Only - General\

\f1\b\fs24
controls.remediation:
\

\f2\b0 Run the following to remove the 
\f0 \cf4 Server with GUI
\f2 \cf2  group:\
1. Run the following command to install the 
\f0 \cf4 Minimal Install
\f2 \cf2  group:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # dnf groupinstall -y "Minimal Install"\

\f1\b\fs24 Note:
\f2\b0  This is important to update dependencies to allow the removal of the 
\f0 \cf4 Server\
with GUI
\f2 \cf2  group with minimal impact to the system functionality.\
2. Run the following command to remove the 
\f0 \cf4 Server with GUI
\f2 \cf2  group:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # dnf groupremove -y "Server with GUI"\

\f2\fs24 3. Run the following command to install the 
\f0 \cf4 Server
\f2 \cf2  group:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # dnf groupinstall -y "Server"\

\f2\fs24 4. Run the following command to reboot the system:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli1
controls.references:
\

\f2\b0 1. removing-gui-rhel-8\

\f1\b

controls.title: Ensure X window server services are not in use\
controls.description:
\

\f2\b0 The X Window System provides a Graphical User Interface (GUI) where users can have\
multiple windows in which to run programs and various add on. The X Windows system\
is typically used on workstations where users login, but not on servers where users\
typically do not login.\

\f1\b
controls.rationale:
\

\f2\b0 Unless your organization specifically requires graphical login access via X Windows,\
remove it to reduce the potential attack surface.\

\f1\b
controls.impact:
\

\f2\b0 If a Graphical Desktop Manager (GDM) is in use on the system, there may be a\
dependency on the 
\f0 \cf4 xorg-x11-server-common
\f2 \cf2  package. If the GDM is required and\
approved by local site policy, the package should 
\f1\b not
\f2\b0  be removed.\
Many Linux systems run applicati
controls.audit_command:
\
- IF -
\f2\b0  a Graphical Desktop Manager or X-Windows server is not required and approved\
by local site policy:\
Run the following command to Verify X Windows Server is not installed.\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # rpm -q xorg-x11-server-common\
package xorg-x11-server-common is not installed\

\f1\b\fs24
controls.remediation:
\
- IF -
\f2\b0  a Graphical Desktop Manager or X-Windows server is not required and approved\
by local site policy:\
Run the following command to remove the X Windows Server packages:\

\f4\fs20\fsmilli10080 # dnf remove xorg-x11-server-common
\f2 Page 351\

\f0 Internal Only - General\

\f1\b\fs24
controls.references:
\

\f2\b0 1. NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 5: CM-11\
2. NIST SP 800-53A :: CM-6.1 (iv)\
3. RHEL 8 STIG Vul ID: V-230553\
4. RHEL 8 STIG Rule ID: SV-230553r809324\

\f1\b
